docs.snippet: In a week the early part of which showed no particular trend in the foreign exchanges, there developed suddenly and unexpectedly on Friday a heavy demand for spot sterling which lifted that, currency for a good size gain but brought in its wake a...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a week the early part of which showed no particular trend in the foreign exchanges, there developed suddenly and unexpectedly on Friday a heavy demand for spot sterling which lifted that, currency for a good size gain but brought in its wake a depressed market in "forwards" and a consequently soft undertone in discounts.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 17 -- A plan to carry out the partition of Palestine without the active participation of Great Britain was approved unanimously tonight by the partition subcommittee of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 17 -- A plan to carry out the partition of Palestine without the active participation of Great Britain was approved unanimously tonight by the partition subcommittee of the United Nations General Assembly.

headline.main: New Plan of Palestine Partition Would Set Up 2 States by Oct. 1; NEW PLAN TO DIVIDE PALESTINE REACHED

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 18 -- Meeting in three sessions today, a United Nations subcommittee on Palestine virtually completed its report on the partition of the Holy Land. The subcommittee was spurred to added effort by the urgent pleading of Andrew...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 18 -- Meeting in three sessions today, a United Nations subcommittee on Palestine virtually completed its report on the partition of the Holy Land. The subcommittee was spurred to added effort by the urgent pleading of Andrew J. Cordier, executive assistant to the Secretary General, on behalf of Assembly President Oswaldo Aranha to complete its work to meet the Assembly's time schedule.

headline.main: PARTITION PROJECT NEARLY COMPLETE; U.N. Subgroup on Palestine Agrees on Immigration -- Cordier Pleads for Speed

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Representatives of organizations embracing persons of Ukrainian descent in the countries of North and South America will petition the United Nations General Assembly to halt what is termed "the deliberate policy of genocide being pursued by Soviet...
docs.lead_paragraph: Representatives of organizations embracing persons of Ukrainian descent in the countries of North and South America will petition the United Nations General Assembly to halt what is termed "the deliberate policy of genocide being pursued by Soviet Russia and its satellite nations," which, they charge, is a threat to lasting peace.

headline.main: UKRAINE GROUPS URGE U.N. CHECK ON SOVIET

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 19 -- A summary of the report submitted today by subcommittee 2 of the United Nations General Assembly's Committee on the Palestine question follows: INTRODUCTION At the outset the subcommittee decided to concentrate on three...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 19 -- A summary of the report submitted today by subcommittee 2 of the United Nations General Assembly's Committee on the Palestine question follows: INTRODUCTION At the outset the subcommittee decided to concentrate on three broad issues: 1. The legal questions arising from the Palestine problem.

headline.main: Summary of Report to U.N. on a Unitary State in Palestine

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Moore-McCormack Lines, operators of the Good Neighbor Fleet in the New York-South American route, announced yesterday that reconversion work on the three 20,000-ton liners Uruguay, Argentina and Brazil would be speeded up, with the country's major...
docs.lead_paragraph: Moore-McCormack Lines, operators of the Good Neighbor Fleet in the New York-South American route, announced yesterday that reconversion work on the three 20,000-ton liners Uruguay, Argentina and Brazil would be speeded up, with the country's major repair yards returning to full volume after the long strike.
docs.abstract: On way to Kearny, NJ, for final reconversion; illus

headline.main: A SHIP OF THE GOOD NEIGHBOR FLEET

docs.snippet: LONDON, Nov. 19 -- Continued expansion in coal and steel output, plus a crop of good dividend reports sent industrial shares up in the stock markets here today. All groups advanced and prices generally closed at the top.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 19 -- Continued expansion in coal and steel output, plus a crop of good dividend reports sent industrial shares up in the stock markets here today. All groups advanced and prices generally closed at the top.

headline.main: BONDS AND SHARES ON LONDON MARKET; Steel, Coal Output Rise and Good Dividend Reports, Send Industrials Up

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 19 -- A summary of the report submitted by Subcommittee 1 of the United Nations General Assembly's Ad Hoc Committee on Palestine follows: The report recommends a draft resolution for the General Assembly that would declare...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 19 -- A summary of the report submitted by Subcommittee 1 of the United Nations General Assembly's Ad Hoc Committee on Palestine follows: The report recommends a draft resolution for the General Assembly that would declare that the present situation in Palestine is likely to impair the general welfare and friendly relations among nations.

headline.main: Digest of the U.N. Unit Report Prescribing Measures for Partition of Palestine

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 19 -- As the main battle lines were drawn tonight for the future destiny of Palestine, it became known that a new British statement would be made here tomorrow to the Palestine committee of the United Nations General...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., Nov. 19 -- As the main battle lines were drawn tonight for the future destiny of Palestine, it became known that a new British statement would be made here tomorrow to the Palestine committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
